business.headline: Sensex opens 69 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; HDFC Bank up 1%Sensex opens 69 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; HDFC Bank up 1%

Anthem Biosciences IPO to close for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMPThis IPO is entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares by existing shareholders. The company itself will not receive any money from this offer. The price band has been set at Rs 570 per share.

Big GST changes ahead? Centre signals green light, says reportThe Prime Minister's Office (PMO) has given an in-principle nod to a revamp of the GST structure, paving the way for possible reforms in the upcoming GST Council meeting scheduled for August.

The Theobroma story: How 2 sisters turned a cafe into 225-store pan-India chainPrivate equity firm ChrysCapital has struck a sweet deal to acquire a 90% stake in Theobroma Foods for Rs 2,410 crore. The bakery chain, started by two sisters in Mumbai, has grown into a 225-store brand loved for its brownies and cakes. Read on to know more about the Mumbai-based bakery chain.

MTNL misses Rs 8,585 crore payments, owes 7 public sector banksIn a filing on Tuesday, MTNL confirmed that it has defaulted on both principal and interest payments to a group of lenders, which include some of India's biggest state-owned banks.
Sensex ends 317 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 317.45 points to end at 82,570.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 113.50 points to close at 25,195.80.

Anthem Biosciences IPO fully booked: Should you subscribe? Check listing gainsThe IPO opened for subscription on July 14, aims to raise Rs 3,395 crore through a complete offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares.

Why Rs 12 crore didn't make this man happy? Investment advisor explainsWhile money matters, it should never cost you your health, peace of mind, or precious family time. True wealth is living well, not just stacking numbers in a bank account, says an investment advisor.

Why Zerodha's Nithin Kamath wants short selling made easy in IndiaIf someone wants to short a stock today, they mostly do it through futures or options. But there's a catch, there are only 224 stocks in India that have futures and options. So if a bad company is not on that list, no one can short it easily.

Theobroma to be sold, Rs 2,410-crore sweet deal baked by ChrysCapital: ReportFounded in 2004 by sisters Kainaz Messman Harchandrai and Tina Messman Wykes, Theobroma began with a single outlet at Cusrow Baug on Mumbai's Colaba Causeway.

Claiming fake ITR refunds? Here's what could happenTo give honest taxpayers a chance to fix their mistakes, the department had earlier asked people to revise their returns if they had claimed any wrong deductions.

Explained: Why HCLTech shares are down 4% todayOver the past few days, HCLTech has been under pressure. The stock has declined 7.9% in the last five trading sessions, 9.58% in the past month, and over 14.6% in the past six months.

Tesla showroom now in Mumbai. Price list of Model Y EVs in India revealed Live UpdatesThe Mumbai showroom will serve as Tesla's main display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.
Sensex opens 119 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Tata Motors up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 176.33 points to 82,429.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.50 points to 25,145.80 as of 9:29 am.

Tesla's Model Y to debut in India at Rs 60 lakhIn comparison, the Model Y starts at $44,990 in the United States, 263,500 yuan in China, and 45,970 euros in Germany. This makes the Indian version one of the most expensive, mainly due to import duties and logistics costs.

Sensex, Nifty today: Inflation drops, but will stock markets rise?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,166 points around 8:22 am, suggesting a possible higher start for Nifty50, which closed at 25,082.3 on Monday. This points to cautious optimism on Dalal Street after four straight sessions of losses.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO allotment: Online guide to see status. Check GMPInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (also known as Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Bitcoin hits record $123,000 as US policy hopes boost crypto marketBitcoin is up about 30% so far this year and its rise has lifted other coins too. Ether, the second-biggest token, climbed to a five-month high of $3,059. XRP and Solana also rose about 3% each.

Retail inflation cools to 6-year low of 2.10% in JuneThis is the fifth month in a row that inflation has remained below the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) medium-term target of 4%, and the eighth consecutive month it has stayed under the central bank's upper limit of 6%
Sensex closes 247 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Eternal up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 247.01 points to close at 82,253.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 67.55 points to end at 25,082.30.

Trap, click, renew: How OTT apps make it hard to cancel subscriptionsAccording to data collected by community platform LocalCircles, 50% of respondents said they have frequently had difficulty cancelling subscriptions to digital services.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta on why your portfolio should be yours, not someone else'sBuilding your investment portfolio should match your own risk comfort, timeframe and goals. What works for your friend may not work for you, says MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, Radhika Gupta.

Why your tax refund may be delayed this yearOne big reason for the delay is that the tax filing season began late this year. Normally, people can file their returns from April onwards. But this time, the Income Tax Department released the ITR utilities quite late.
Sensex down 400 points: Why is stock market falling todayAs of 11:50 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down by 388.85 points to 82,111.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 110.85 points to 25,039.00.

Only 6.7% filed ITRs: CoinSwitch co-founder on why Indians delay tax filingIndia has made big progress in digital tax filing over the years. There are new portals, better forms and more ways to pay taxes online. Yet, millions still wait till the last few days to get their documents in order.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares gained 5% todayOla Electric share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 43.60 before trading 5.45% higher at Rs 41.99 around 11:11 am, shortly after the electric two-wheeler maker announced its financial results for the first quarter of FY26.

Bitcoin zooms past $120,000 to reach all-time high. Here's whyThe world's largest cryptocurrency was last seen trading at $120,700.54, up 1.32%, as investor confidence remained strong ahead of important regulatory discussions in the United States.
Sensex, Nifty start week in red as IT stocks drag markets lower againThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 266.34 points to 82,234.13, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 67.95 points to 25,081.90 as of 9:22 am.

Travel Food Services to make market debut today; here's the latest GMPTravel Food Services listing: The grey market premium (GMP), which had dropped sharply in the past week, has seen a slight rise ahead of the listing.

Jane Street deposits Rs 4,843.5 crore, set to return to Dalal Street: ReportIn its interim order, Sebi had accused Jane Street of using manipulative strategies in Indian stock markets. The regulator directed the firm to deposit alleged unlawful gains in an escrow account with a scheduled commercial bank in India.

Why claiming your PF money seems so difficultIt all starts with tiny mistakes. A spelling error in your name, a mismatch in your date of birth, or an old bank account number can be enough to freeze your claim.

Will India be hit with a 500% tariff? Here's what we knowIndia remains one of the few countries still in talks with the US at a time when the Trump administration is preparing to enforce steep new tariffs on imports from several nations starting August 1.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

entertainment.headline: Salman Khan's Bajrangi Bhaijaan 2 in works? Director confirms talks with actorDirector Kabir Khan has confirmed that he and Salman Khan are in talks for 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan 2', but they are waiting for the right story before moving forward. The director emphasised that the sequel would only be made to honour the original's legacy, not just for box office success.

Movie tickets in Karnataka to cost Rs 200 in theatres, multiplexes. Here's howKarnataka has re-introduced a Rs 200 cap on cinema ticket prices. This move could encourage audiences to visit theatres, potentially increasing attendance amidst past resistance from multiplexes.
Telugu actor Ravi Teja's father dies at 90Telugu actor Ravi Teja's father, Rajagopal Raju, died at the age of 90 on Tuesday. More details on the funeral and cremation are awaited.

Boss is back: Abhishek's shoutout to father Amitabh Bachchan with new KBC promoAbhishek Bachchan gave a special shoutout to his father, Amitabh Bachchan, by sharing the latest promo of Kaun Banega Crorepati. The new season premieres on August 11 on Sony Entertainment Television and SonyLIV.

Nysa-Orry mimic Ajay Devgn's viral 'Pehla Tu' step, fans call it best video everNysa Devgn recreated her father Ajay Devgn's viral dance move from 'Son of Sardaar 2' with Orhan Awatramani aka Orry. Internet users were taken by surprise seeing Nysa's effortless charm.

Toronto rapper stabbed in London hours after attending Drake's UK tour showToronto rapper Top5, recently cleared of murder charges, was stabbed in North London after attending a Drake concert. Police say his injuries are not life-threatening; no arrests have been made.

Kathy Bates makes Emmy history with 'Matlock' drama nominationNoah Wyle and Adam Scott earned their first Best Actor Emmy nominations. Kathy Bates made history with Matlock. The Emmy Awards will air live on September 14 from Los Angeles.
Kiara Advani-Sidharth Malhotra welcome a baby girlKiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra welcomed their first child today. The couple was blessed with a baby girl.

Emmy nominations 2025: Severance leads with 27, followed by Penguin, White LotusThe 2025 Emmy nominations have been announced. Adam Scott-starrer 'Severance' leads with 27 nominations, followed by 'The Penguin' with 24 and 'The White Lotus' and 'The Studio' with 23 each.

Bimal Roy's Do Bigha Zamin to be screened in 4K at Venice Film Festival 2025The Venice Film Festival 2025 will screen a restored 4K version of Bimal Roy's 'Do Bigha Zamin'. This screening is significant as it highlights the film's impact on Indian cinema and the restoration effort.

Dominic McLaughlin: Meet the actor behind HBO's Harry PotterProduction has officially commenced on HBO's Harry Potter television series. HBO revealed the first glimpse of young Harry, portrayed by Dominic McLaughlin. Here's all you need to know about him.

Emmys 2025 nominations: Reality, talk show categories announced ahead of full listThe nominations for two categories of the 2025 Emmy Awards have been unveiled, with CBS Mornings making the official announcement. Take a look at the nominations below.

Mandala Murders trailer: Vaani Kapoor as detective is up against crime and sorceryActor Vaani Kapoor plays investigating officer Rea Thomas in Yash Raj Films' mythological-crime-thriller—'Mandala Murders'. The upcoming Netflix show blends crime investigation with mystical elements.

Su From So trailer: Raj B Shetty's supernatural comedy promises a laugh riot'Su From So' is a Kannada supernatural comedy drama film written and directed by JP Thuminad, who also stars in the film featuring several known faces from films like 'Kantara' and 'Sapta Sagaradaache Ello'.

Rangeen first look: Vineet Kumar Singh's new show to explore love and betrayalPrime Video announced the release of its upcoming comedy-drama series-'Rangeen', featuring Vineet Kumar Singh and Rajshri Deshpande. The show is backed by Kabir Khan and Rajan Kapoor.

Producer Naga Vamsi confirms Jr NTR has full role in War 2, not a cameoProducer Naga Vamsi clarified fan speculation about Jr NTR's screen time in 'War 2', confirming the actor has a full-length role alongside Hrithik Roshan.

The best BTS albums of all time, rankedAs BTS memebers Jin, SUGA, J-Hope, RM, Jimin, V, and Jungkook gear up for a historic comeback, now is the perfect time to relive the music that built their legacy. Here are BTS albums ranked. Read more to see if your favourite pick made the list.

Aap Jaisa Koi exposes patriarchy of permission because who are you to allow me?In that one question, 'Aap Jaisa Koi' cuts through the soft-spoken patriarchy that hides behind smiles, affection, and so-called respect.

AP Dhillon and Tara Sutaria set to collaborate for Thodi Si Daaru song. Watch teaserPunjabi singer AP Dhillon and actor Tara Sutaria will be seen in the upcoming song 'Thodi Si Daaru'. Fans expressed excitement on the song's teaser, which was released on social media on Tuesday.

general news.headline: NRI arrested in hit-and-run death of legendary marathoner Fauja SinghDuring police questioning, NRI Amritpal Singh Dhillon revealed that he was returning from Mukerian after selling his phone when his vehicle struck 114-year-old athlete Fauja Singh near Bias Pind.

100% secondary sanctions for Russia trade: Nato warns India, China, BrazilMark Rutte warned the leaders of China, India, and Brazil that if they continued trading with Russia and buying its oil and gas, he would impose 100 per cent secondary sanctions.

Why no cockpit video recorder? Air India crash triggers demand, debateThe fuel-switch report in the Air India Boeing 787 crash probe has sparked a demand for a cockpit video recorder. The NTSB of the US that probes air crashes has for years batted for one. If cockpit voice recorders are part of the black boxes of planes, what has kept cockpit video recorders, which would aid air crash investigations, from being installed?

India urges Dhaka to reconsider Satyajit Ray's home demolition, offers repair helpThe house was built by Satyajit Ray's grandfather, Upendra Kishore Ray Chowdhury, who was also the father of celebrated poet Sukumar Ray.

The ball that bowled Siraj in Lord's Test: A freak delivery and pure bad luckEngland vs India: In a surreal final twist at Lord's, Mohammed Siraj was bowled by a delivery from Shoaib Bashir that spun off the pitch, the bat, and then the pitch again - a freak dismissal that defied cricketing logic. Siraj's gritty 30-ball stay ended when he was bowled as England went on to win a thriller by 22 runs.
ChatGPT down: AI chatbot shows unusual activity error to some users, many unable to loginOpenAI's ChatGPT and related services went down globally, leaving users unable to log in or complete tasks.

Trump confident of trade deal with India: Going to have accessUS President Donald Trump updated on America's ongoing trade talks with India, showing hope and confidence, ahead of August 1, when his steep tariffs will come into effect.

But the decision between water and landings goes far deeper than just comfort. This is why Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla splashed down while Wing Commander Rakesh Sharma landed on terra firma 41 years ago.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
